trans-unit.source: Divide whole numbers like 7÷5 to get a decimal
trans-unit.target: Dela upp heltal som 7 ÷ 5 för att få ett decimaltal
trans-unit.note: Context: # Pretty display name for exercise http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/arith-review-decimals/div-decimals/e/dividing-decimals-without-the-standard-algorithm-1 # Pretty display name for exercise http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-fifth-grade-math/cc-5th-arith-operations/cc-5th-dividing-decimals/e/dividing-decimals-without-the-standard-algorithm-1 # Pretty display name for exercise http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-fifth-grade-math/multiplication-and-division/cc-5th-dividing-decimals/e/dividing-decimals-without-the-standard-algorithm-1 # Pretty display name for exercise (xb5804973) on the hy stage # Pretty display name for exercise (xb5804973) on the pt stage # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: ka) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: zh-hans) # (format: text) #: intl/datastore:1

trans-unit.source:
###Student B's solution

I converted the division problem to a fraction with a denominator of $100$. 

$5 \div 4 = \dfrac{5}{4}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Rewrite the division problem as a fraction}}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = \dfrac{5 \times 25}{4 \times 25}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Multiply the top and bottom by 25}}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = \dfrac{125}{100}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = 1.25$
trans-unit.target:
###Student B: s lösning

Jag konverterade divisionproblemet till en fraktion med en nämnare av $100$. 

$5 \div 4 = \dfrac{5}{4}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Skriv om delningsproblemet som en fraktion}}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = \dfrac{5 \times 25}{4 \times 25}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Multiplicera topp och botten med 25}}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = \dfrac{125}{100}$

$\phantom{5 \div 2} = 1.25$

trans-unit.source:
Let's rewrite as a fraction and factor out multiples of $10$:

$10 \div 40 = \dfrac{10}{40}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Rewrite the division problem as a fraction}}$

$\phantom{10 \div 40} = \dfrac{1 \times 10}{4 \times 10}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Factor out multiples of 10}}$
trans-unit.target:
Låt oss skriva om som en fraktion och faktor ut multiplar av $10$:

$10 \div 40 = \dfrac{10}{40}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Skriv om delningsproblemet som en fraktion}}$

$\phantom{10 \div 40} = \dfrac{1 \times 10}{4 \times 10}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Faktor ut multiplar av 10}}$

trans-unit.source:
Let's rewrite as a fraction and factor out multiples of $10$:

$10 \div 500 = \dfrac{10}{500}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Rewrite the division problem as a fraction}}$

$\phantom{10 \div 500} = \dfrac{1 \times 10}{5 \times 100}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Factor out multiples of 10}}$
trans-unit.target:
Låt oss skriva om som en fraktion och faktor ut multiplar av $10$:

$10 \div 500 = \dfrac{10}{500}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Skriv om delningsproblemet som en fraktion}}$

$\phantom{10 \div 500} = \dfrac{1 \times 10}{5 \times 100}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Faktor ut multiplar av 10}}$

trans-unit.source:
Let's rewrite as a fraction and factor out multiples of $10$:

$100 \div 400 = \dfrac{100}{400}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Rewrite the division problem as a fraction}}$

$\phantom{100 \div 400} = \dfrac{1 \times 100}{4 \times 100}~~~~~~~~\small\gray{\text{Factor out multiples of 10}}$
trans-unit.target:
Låt oss skriva om som en fraktion och faktor ut multiplar av $10$:

trans-unit.source:
###Student A's solution

I thought in terms of tenths:

$\phantom{=}0.5 - 0.3$

$=5$ tenths $- ~3$ tenths

$=2$ tenths

$=0.2$
trans-unit.target:
###Elev A:s lösning

tänkt i termer om tiondelar:

$\phantom{=}0.5 - 0.3$

$=5$ tiondelar $- ~3$ tiondelar

$=2$ tiondelar

$=0.2$

trans-unit.source:
$\blue{10\dfrac{2}{10}}$ can be regrouped so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{10\dfrac{2}{10}} &= \blue{10+ \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9+ 1 + \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9+ \dfrac{10}{10} + \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9\dfrac{12}{10}} \\
\end{align}$
trans-unit.target:
$\blue{10\dfrac{2}{10}}$ kan omgrupperas så att den delade delen är **större** än $\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{10\dfrac{2}{10}} &= \blue{10+ \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9+ 1 + \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9+ \dfrac{10}{10} + \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{9\dfrac{12}{10}} \\
\end{align}$

trans-unit.source:
$\blue{6\dfrac{5}{10}}$ can be regrouped so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\pink{\dfrac{9}{10}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{6\dfrac{5}{10}} &= \blue{6+ \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5+ 1 + \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5+ \dfrac{10}{10} + \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5\dfrac{15}{10}} \\
\end{align}$
trans-unit.target:
$\blue{6\dfrac{5}{10}}$ kan omgrupperas så att den delade delen är **större** än $\pink{\dfrac{9}{10}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{6\dfrac{5}{10}} &= \blue{6+ \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5+ 1 + \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5+ \dfrac{10}{10} + \dfrac{5}{10}} \\
\\
&= \blue{5\dfrac{15}{10}} \\
\end{align}$

trans-unit.source: $\\blue{8\\dfrac{1}{8}} - \\pink{3\\dfrac{3}{8}} = \\green{4\\dfrac{6}{8}}$\n\nThe answer can also be written as $\\green{4\\dfrac{3}{4}}$ .

trans-unit.source:
$\blue{8\dfrac{1}{8}}$ can be regrouped so that the fractional part is **greater** than $\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{8\dfrac{1}{8}} &= \blue{8+ \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7+ 1 + \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7+ \dfrac{8}{8} + \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7\dfrac{9}{8}} 
\end{align}$
trans-unit.target:
$\blue{8\dfrac{1}{8}}$ kan omgrupperas så att den delade delen är **större** än $\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.

$\begin{align}
\blue{8\dfrac{1}{8}} &= \blue{8+ \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7+ 1 + \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7+ \dfrac{8}{8} + \dfrac{1}{8}} \\
\\
&= \blue{7\dfrac{9}{8}} 
\end{align}$

trans-unit.source:
Because $\green{\dfrac{12}{10}}$ is greater than $1$, it must be converted into a mixed number.

$\begin{align}
\green{\dfrac{12}{10}} &= \green{\dfrac{10}{10} + \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \green{1 \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\end{align}$

Then, we put the $\green{\dfrac{2}{10}}$ under the fractions and the $\green{1}$ with the other whole numbers.

$\begin{align}
&\green{1} \\
&\blue{4} &\blue{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\\\
+&\pink{5}&\pink{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{2}{10}}\\
\end{align}$
trans-unit.target:
Eftersom $\green{\dfrac{12}{10}}$ är större än $1$ gör vi om det till ett tal i blandad form med en heltalsdel.

$\begin{align}
\green{\dfrac{12}{10}} &= \green{\dfrac{10}{10} + \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\\
&= \green{1 \dfrac{2}{10}} \\
\end{align}$

Så tar vi summan och skriver bråkdelen $\green{\dfrac{2}{10}}$ under bråken och heltalet $\green{1}$ med de andra heltalen.

$\begin{align}
&\green{1} \\
&\blue{4} &\blue{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\\\
+&\pink{5}&\pink{\dfrac{6}{10}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{2}{10}}\\
\end{align}$
trans-unit.note: Context: # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/arith-review-fractions/add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-fourth-grade-math/cc-4th-fractions-topic/cc-4th-add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the hy stage. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the pt stage. # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (format: perseus_text) #: intl/datastore:1

Because $\green{\dfrac{12}{8}}$ is greater than $1$, it must be converted into a mixed number.

$\begin{align}
\green{\dfrac{12}{8}} &= \green{\dfrac{8}{8} + \dfrac{4}{8}} \\
\\
&= \green{1 \dfrac{4}{8}} \\
\end{align}$

Then, we put the $\green{\dfrac{4}{8}}$ under the fractions and the $\green{1}$ with the other whole numbers.

&\green{1} \\
&\blue{2} &\blue{\dfrac{5}{8}}\\\\
+&\pink{4}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{8}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{4}{8}}\\
\end{align}$

$\begin{align}
\green{\dfrac{12}{8}} &= \green{\dfrac{8}{8} + \dfrac{4}{8}} \\
\\
&= \green{1 \dfrac{4}{8}} \\

Så tar vi summan och skriver bråkdelen $\green{\dfrac{4}{8}}$ under bråken och heltalet $\green{1}$ med de andra heltalen.

trans-unit.source:
We can line up the mixed numbers by their whole number parts and fractional parts, and then add the fractions first:

$\begin{align}
&\blue{2} &\blue{\dfrac{5}{8}}\\\\
+&\pink{4}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{8}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{12}{8}}\\
\end{align}$
trans-unit.target:
Vi ställer upp talen i blandad form med heltalsdelarna till vänster och bråkdelarna till höger. Sedan börjar vi med att addera bråkdelarna:

$\begin{align}
&\blue{2} &\blue{\dfrac{5}{8}}\\\\
+&\pink{4}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{8}}\\
\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{12}{8}}\\
\end{align}$
trans-unit.note: Context: # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/arith-review-fractions/add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-fourth-grade-math/cc-4th-fractions-topic/cc-4th-add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the hy stage. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the pt stage. # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (format: perseus_text) #: intl/datastore:1

\hline{}\\
&&\green{\dfrac{12}{10}}\\
\end{align}$
trans-unit.target:
Vi ställer upp talen i blandad form med heltalsdelarna till vänster och bråkdelarna till höger. Sedan börjar vi med att addera bråkdelarna:

trans-unit.source:
We can line up the mixed numbers by their whole number parts and fractional parts, and then look at the fractions first. 

$\begin{align}
&\blue{10} &\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}}\\\\
-&\pink{3}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}\\
\hline{}\\
\end{align}$

We can't subtract $\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}} - \pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$, because $\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}}$ is **less** than $\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.
trans-unit.target:
Vi kan ställa upp de blandade siffrorna med deras hela antal delar och fraktioner, och titta sedan på fraktionerna först. 

$\begin{align}
&\blue{10} &\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}}\\\\
-&\pink{3}&\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}\\
\hline{}\\
\end{align}$

Vi kan inte subtrahera $\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}} - \pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$eftersom $\blue{\dfrac{2}{10}}$ är **mindre** än $\pink{\dfrac{7}{10}}$.
trans-unit.note: Context: # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/arith-review-fractions/add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-fourth-grade-math/cc-4th-fractions-topic/cc-4th-add-sub-mixed-numbers/e/adding-and-subtracting-mixed-numbers-with-like-denominators-2. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the hy stage. # Exercise at (x1c180609) on the pt stage. # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (format: perseus_text) #: intl/datastore:1

trans-unit.source:
We can line up the mixed numbers by their whole number parts and fractional parts, and then subtract the fractions first:

$\begin{align}
&\blue{8} &\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}}\\\\
-&\pink{3}&\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}\\
\hline\end{align}$

We can't subtract $\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}} - \pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$, because $\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}}$ is **less** than $\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.
trans-unit.target:
Vi kan ställa in de blandade talen med deras hela antal delar och fraktioner, och sedan subtrahera fraktionerna först:

$\begin{align}
&\blue{8} &\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}}\\\\
-&\pink{3}&\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}\\
\hline\end{align}$

Vi kan inte subtrahera $\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}} - \pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$eftersom $\blue{\dfrac{1}{8}}$ är **mindre** än $\pink{\dfrac{3}{8}}$.

trans-unit.source: A fact family is made up of $3$ numbers that are all related. \n\nFor example, $\\blueD2\\times \\purpleD4 = \\greenD8$, so $\\greenD8\\div\\purpleD4 = \\blueD2$.
trans-unit.target: En faktafamilj består av $3$ nummer som är relaterade till varandra. \n\nTill exempel $\\blueD2\\times \\purpleD4 = \\greenD8$, så $\\greenD8\\div\\purpleD4 = \\blueD2$.
trans-unit.note: Context: # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/multiply-divide/relate-mult-div/e/relate-division-to-multiplication. # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-third-grade-math/cc-3rd-mult-div-topic/cc-3rd-relate-mult-div/e/relate-division-to-multiplication. # Exercise at (x8a03e0ba) on the bg stage. # Exercise at (x8a03e0ba) on the hy stage. # Exercise at (x8a03e0ba) on the pt stage. # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: fr) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: ja) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: ka) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: zh-hans) # (format: perseus_text) #: intl/datastore:1

trans-unit.source: Remember $8\\times 5$ means $8$ groups of $5$.\n\nIf you're stuck, try skip counting by $5$ eight times.
trans-unit.target: Kom ihåg $8\\times 5$ betyder $8$ grupper av $5$.\n\nOm du har fastnat, försök hoppa över räkningen med $5$ åtta gånger.
trans-unit.note: Context: # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/multiply-divide/relate-mult-div/e/relate-division-to-multiplication. # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-third-grade-math/cc-3rd-mult-div-topic/cc-3rd-relate-mult-div/e/relate-division-to-multiplication. # Exercise at (x8a03e0ba) on the bg stage. # Exercise at (x8a03e0ba) on the hy stage. # Exercise at (x8a03e0ba) on the pt stage. # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: fr) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: ja) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: ka) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: zh-hans) # (format: perseus_text) #: intl/datastore:1

trans-unit.source: Remember $8\\times 8$ means $8$ groups of $8$.\n\nIf you're stuck, try skip counting by $8$ eight times.
trans-unit.target: Kom ihåg $8\\times 8$ betyder $8$ grupper av $8$.\n\nOm du har fastnat, försök hoppa över räkningen med $8$ åtta gånger.

trans-unit.source: Think about how many equal groups of $6$ it would take to make a total of $48$.\n\nIf you're stuck, try skip counting by $6$ or repeated addition $6+6+6...$ to get to $48$.
trans-unit.target: Tänk på hur många lika grupper av $6$ det skulle ta för att göra totalt $48$.\n\nOm du har fastnat, försök hoppa över räkningen med $6$ eller upprepat tillägg $6+6+6...$ för att komma till $48$.
trans-unit.note: Context: # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/arithmetic-home/multiply-divide/relate-mult-div/e/relate-division-to-multiplication. # Exercise at http://translate.khanacademy.org/math/cc-third-grade-math/cc-3rd-mult-div-topic/cc-3rd-relate-mult-div/e/relate-division-to-multiplication. # Exercise at (x8a03e0ba) on the bg stage. # Exercise at (x8a03e0ba) on the hy stage. # Exercise at (x8a03e0ba) on the pt stage. # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: bg) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: de) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: es) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: fr) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: hy) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: ja) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: ka) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: pt) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: shared) # (KA_SOURCE_TREE: zh-hans) # (format: perseus_text) #: intl/datastore:1

trans-unit.source: The absolute value (or *magnitude*) of $B$ is equal to the absolute value of $A$, so both numbers tell us to move the same distance. \n\n![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/90e23355989bef30c1694984d460b05edb5f8b38)
trans-unit.target: Det absoluta värdet (eller *magnitud*) av $B$ är lika med det absoluta värdet av $A$, så båda talen berättar för oss att flytta samma avstånd. \n\n![](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/90e23355989bef30c1694984d460b05edb5f8b38)
